dt: {bc}something legally submitted to a tribunal to ascertain the truth of a matter
{bc}one who voluntarily confesses a crime and testifies for the prosecution against one's accomplices

shortdef: something that furnishes proof : testimony; specifically : something legally submitted to a tribunal to ascertain the truth of a matter
one who bears witness; especially : one who voluntarily confesses a crime and testifies for the prosecution against one's accomplices

pt: {sc}show{/sc} {sc}manifest{/sc} {sc}evidence{/sc} {sc}evince{/sc} {sc}demonstrate{/sc} mean to reveal outwardly or make apparent. {sc}show{/sc} is the general term but sometimes implies that what is revealed must be gained by inference from acts, looks, or words.

pt.t: careful not to {it}show{/it} his true feelings

pt: {sc}manifest{/sc} implies a plainer, more immediate revelation.

pt.t: {it}manifested{/it} musical ability at an early age

pt: {sc}evidence{/sc} suggests serving as proof of the actuality or existence of something.

pt.t: a commitment {it}evidenced{/it} by years of loyal service

pt: {sc}evince{/sc} implies a showing by outward marks or signs.
{sc}demonstrate{/sc} implies showing by action or by display of feeling.

shortdef: to offer evidence of : prove, evince

dt: {bc}evidence that tends to prove a fact by proving other events or circumstances which afford a basis for a reasonable inference of the occurrence of the fact at issue

shortdef: evidence that tends to prove a fact by proving other events or circumstances which afford a basis for a reasonable inference of the occurrence of the fact at issue

dt: {bc}evidence based not on a witness's personal knowledge but on another's statement not made under oath

shortdef: evidence based not on a witness's personal knowledge but on another's statement not made under oath

dt: {bc}evidence that establishes immediately collateral facts from which the main fact may be inferred {bc}{sx|circumstantial evidence||}

shortdef: evidence that establishes immediately collateral facts from which the main fact may be inferred : circumstantial evidence

dt: {bc}the quality or state of being self-evident

shortdef: the quality or state of being self-evident

dt: {bc}a participant in a crime or an accomplice who gives evidence for the prosecution especially in return for a reduced sentence
used chiefly in the phrase {it}turn state's evidence{/it}

shortdef: a participant in a crime or an accomplice who gives evidence for the prosecution especially in return for a reduced sentence; also : the evidence given —used chiefly in the phrase turn state's evidence
